body: $amzn $tsla $aapl 2021 resistances. New supports

$AMD $QQQ $NVDA $AAPL a major part of why tech stocks have started to selloff is partly due to 10yr T yields rising. But mind you if you were around in late 2018, the stock market took a major dip because treasury yields spiking above 3% meant possible correction. We saw a similar selloff in early 2020 and early 2021 from rising yields. After a few days decline, what did asset managers do? Jump back into the stock market, particularly in techs. For those who are a bit less experienced, let me reassure you, systemic selling by institutions and larger asset managers have not occurred because the volume shows it is relatively low. The problem is lake of liquidity due to buyers. So drop in prices are enhanced when sellers are taking profits. This will be a value play and with a major drop in techs recently, I gut feeling is that asset managers will load into techs prior to Q1 earnings, as we have seen. Manage your risks, but I am bullish here.

$AMC $GME $TSLA $AAPL
